title: DESIGN DEFECT: Remove APR versioning - ONE format ONLY
design_violation: APR format should be ONE self-contained format. Versioning (v1, v2) creates unnecessary complexity and confusion.
five_whys: WHY versioning exists? → Historical evolution of format
WHY is this bad? → Users confused about which version to use
WHY confusion? → No clear migration path or deprecation
WHY no deprecation? → v1 never formally deprecated
ROOT CAUSE: Versioning added without removing old format - violates KISS principle
toyota_way_principle: Simplify: One format, one spec, one mental model

documentation_changes: APR-SPEC.md: Remove 'v2' from section headers and descriptions
fix.code_note: Internal struct names (AprV2Writer, AprV2Metadata) kept for compatibility but documentation refers only to 'APR format'

passed: No documentation refers to 'APR v1' or 'APR v2'
All docs refer to single 'APR format'
Users have one clear format to target
grep 'APR v2' docs/ book/ returns no files
